q: In a test organized by NTA, questions were asked in various sections. Out of the total students, 5% of students cleared the cut-off in all the sections and 5% cleared none. Of the rest, 25% cleared only one section and 20% cleared four sections. If 24.5% of the entire candidates cleared two sections and 300 candidates cleared three sections, determine how many candidates appeared for the test?

Alice is a hackster. She is assigned three tasks for which time allotted is in the ratio of 5:4:2 (jobs are needed to be done individually). But due to some technical snag, 10% of the time allotted for each job gets wasted. Thereafter, owing to the lack of interest, invests only 40%, 30%, and 20% of the hours of what was actually allotted to do the three jobs individually. Determine how much percentage of the total time allotted is the time invested by Alice?

The cost of automobiles has risen up by 15%, labor cost has also increased from 25% of the cost of automobiles to 30% of the cost of automobiles. By how much percentage should there be a reduction in the usage of automobiles so as to keep the cost same?
A candy store sells chocolates. If the store sells 60% of chocholates and still has 760 chocolates. Then calculate the number of chocolates the store had in the beginning?
Alice score 60 marks and Mark scored 75 marks. Calculate how much percent of Alice's mark is Mark's mark?

If Alice's and Bob’s monthly salaries together amount to 18,000 dollars and if Alice spends 65% of her salary and Bob spends 30% of his. After expenditure, if their savings are the same, then calculate Alice’s salary?
If 65% of a number is more than 35% of 1850 by 660, then determine the number?
John took a random number and subtracted 33 from 75% of that number. If the result was 87 then find the number chosen by John?
To clear a class test, John must score 40% marks. If John gets 90 marks and fails by 55 marks, then what is the total marks of the class test?

A school has two alarms A and B. Alarm A rings once every two hours and alarm B rings once every four hours.

Determine the percentage by which the number of times A would ring in 24 hours is greater than the number of times alarm B would ring in that same period?

Julian went to the market and bought fish worth Rs. 30 out of which 50 paise were spent as sales tax. What is the cost of tax-free items if the tax rate is 5%?
Note: Choose the option that coincides with the nearest integer.

Bob has allocated a budget x for painting his shop. However, the price of paint increases by 45%. If Bob decides to spend an additional 30% of x for buying paint then by what percentage will the quantity of paint purchased be reduced?

A library has a collection of books out of which 55% of books are more than 50 years old and 60% of books are less than or equal to 70 years old. Also, 40% of the total collection of books in the library is mostly fictional novels.
If 40% of the books that are more than 70 years old are fictional novels then, what percentage of fictional novels are less than or equal to 70 years?

In a factory packing red and green apples, 6% of the apples were found to be defective. Also, 90% of the non-defective apples were red apples. If 4700 non-defective apples were all green, then how many apples in total were packed in the factory?

You are baking a cake using rare ingredients A, B, and C. Assume that you put 45% of A in the cake. Additionally, you put B as 1/3 of the amount of ingredient C while baking the cake. If the amount of C used to bake the cake is 8 Tablespoons (Tbsp), then how many Tbsp of ingredients were put in the cake?
Note: Assume that no other ingredients apart from A, B and C were used in baking the cake and choose the option that coincides with the nearest integer.

A newspaper hawker selling newspapers and magazines gets 7% commission on all sales up to Rs. 8,000. Additionally, for all sales above Rs. 8000, he gets 5% commission.
If the total sales amount after deducting his commission is Rs. 30,000, then what is the total sales made by him?
